{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3300814,"name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","username":"kevintheengineer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-03T04:35:58.964Z","cooked":"

We have a Neo V1.1 motor but we need it to go faster. We have a VEX pro planetary gearbox (new in box) sku 217-4973. I am 88% sure the motor will mount to the gearbox. We may need to shorten the shaft or use a custom mounting plate for the adapter to be in the correct location. Has anyone done this? or, do I need to buy the MAXplanetary gearbox?

We have the ring collar and the 3:1 gear ratio kit also.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-03T04:36:40.774Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":179,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":929.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":453172,"topic_slug":"neo-v1-1-mounting-to-a-vexpro-planetary-gearbox-sku217-4973","display_username":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/neo-v1-1-mounting-to-a-vexpro-planetary-gearbox-sku217-4973/453172/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3300827,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-03T05:05:29.638Z","cooked":"

Cutting the shaft is the most compact way to do it but there is an adapter that will allow you to not cut it. We relegated all the versa planetary stuff to the back corner only to be used in emergencies since we upgraded to max planetary gearboxes. It would be nice if rev made a gearbox that fit the bill between the ultra planetary and max planetary. That is where the Vex versa planetary lives.

We cut the shaft and use this adapter… https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-4018.html

Maybe I am misunderstanding, but you would like the output to go faster than the neo speed?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-02-03T06:17:48.384Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":453172,"topic_slug":"neo-v1-1-mounting-to-a-vexpro-planetary-gearbox-sku217-4973","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/neo-v1-1-mounting-to-a-vexpro-planetary-gearbox-sku217-4973/453172/4","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3300847,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-03T06:32:59.000Z","cooked":"

That’s my impression as well. If you’re trying to speed up the RPM, do NOT use the MAXplanetary in its normal setup as you will slow the RPM. You need to connect the motor to the normal output shaft and the normal motor side to your output, which will take some work.

I suggest you take a look at Flyer Overdrive Gearbox - AndyMark, Inc instead.

Thanks everyone. Especially for the rather embarrassing question about “Speeding up” using a reducer unit.

We ordered the Flyer Overdrive. We’re basing our shooter on the kitbot, couple of changes… Still in prototype phase.
